Detailed Description

implements a single input single output filter. Initialisation is performed via CDB

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Filter::~Filter ( ) [inline]
Filter::Filter ( ) [inline]

constructor

Member Function Documentation

bool Filter::Init ( ConfigurationDataBase &  cdb) [inline]

Numerator = {a0 a1 a2....} Denominator= {b0 b1 ..... }

OR

0 = {a0 a1 a2....} b0 assumed to be 1 1 = {-b1 -b2..... }

OR

Poles = {p0 p1 ... } => p0 p1 which means ------ * ------ S + p0 S + p1

Zeros = {z0 z1 ... } S + z0 S + z1 whic means ------ * ------ z0 z1 SamplingTime = 1e-3

Gain = g which multiplies the whole expression

The conversion uses the following equation between S and Z uses 2 (1-Z^-1) S = ---------- T (1+Z^-1)

The first two filter configuration are already expressed in z domain, The last one is expressed in s domain and the Filter class discretizes the transfer function using Tustin.
